= How To Use ACPYPI =

[#To_Install test]
== Introduction ==

To run *acpypi* with its all functionalities, you need *ANTECHAMBER* from package
[http://amber.scripps.edu/#AmberTools AmberTools] and
[http://openbabel.org/wiki/Main_Page Open Babel] if your input files are of PDB
format.

However, if one wants *acpypi* just to emulate *amb2gmx.pl*, one needs nothing
at all but *[http://www.python.org Python]*.

At the moment, *acpypi* is only available for download via *svn*:

  * `svn checkout http://acpypi.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/ acpypi`

== To Test ==

At folder *acpypi/test*, type:

  * `../acpypi.py -i FFF.pdb`

It'll create a folder called *FFF.acpypi*, and inside it one may find topology
files for GROMACS and CNS/XPLOR.

To get help and more information, type:

  * `../acpypi.py -h`

== To Install ==

At folder *acpypi*, type:

  * `ln -s $PWD/acpypi.py /usr/local/bin/acpypi`

And re-login or start another shell session.

== To Verify with GMX ==
{{{
cd FFF.acpypi/
grompp -c FFF_GMX.gro -p FFF_GMX.top -f em.mdp -o em.tpr
mdrun -v -deffnm em
# And if you have VMD
vmd em.gro em.trr

# For MD, do:
grompp -c em.gro -p FFF_GMX.top -f md.mdp -o md.tpr
mdrun -v -deffnm md
vmd md.gro md.trr

# with openmpi, for a dual core
grompp -c FFF_GMX.gro -p FFF_GMX.top -f em.mdp -o em.tpr -np 2
om-mpirun -n 2 mdrun_mpi -v -deffnm em
grompp -c em.gro -p FFF_GMX.top -f md.mdp -o md.tpr -np 2
om-mpirun -n 2 mdrun_mpi -v -deffnm md
vmd md.gro md.trr
}}}

== To Emulate _[http://chemistry.csulb.edu/ffamber/tools.html amb2gmx.pl]_ ==

For any given *prmtop* and *inpcrd* files (outputs from AMBER LEaP), type:

  * ` acpypi -p FFF_AC.prmtop -x FFF_AC.inpcrd`

The output files `FFF_GMX.gro` and `FFF_GMX.top` will be generated at the same
folder of the input files.

== To Verify with CNS/XPLOR ==
At folder *FFF.acpypi*, type:

  * `cns < FFF_CNS.inp`
